title: Graph of a function from its derivative behavior

content.question: The derivative of a function f is increasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGacaakiaakoiaadI hacqGH8aapcaaIWaaaaa@3C22@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and decreasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGacaakiaakoiaadI hacqGH+aGpcaaIWaaaaa@3C26@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following could be the graph of f ?

choices.label: The graph of a function is an upward opening parabola that originates in the second quadrant, falls down to a minimum point on the negative y axis, and further rises into the first quadrant.
The graph of a function is a downward opening parabola that originates in the third quadrant, rises up to a maximum point on the positive x axis, and further falls down into the fourth quadrant.

The graph of a function is a curve that originates in the second quadrant as a concave down decreasing curve, passes through the origin, and falls down into the fourth quadrant as a concave up decreasing curve.

The graph of a function is a curve that originates in the third quadrant as a concave down increasing curve, passes through the origin, and rises into the fourth quadrant as a concave up increasing curve.

The graph of a function is a curve that originates in the second quadrant as a concave up decreasing curve, passes through the origin, and falls down into the fourth quadrant as a concave down decreasing curve.

content.answer: The graph of a function is a curve that originates in the second quadrant as a concave up decreasing curve, passes through the origin, and falls down into the fourth quadrant as a concave down decreasing curve.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
